title: Fix force close bug
message:
Fix force close bug

Deleting a category that is currently selected in MainActivity would
cause the app to crash indefinitely. This has been fixed in 2 places:

1. For people currently with the bug, MainActivity checks to make sure
   the category exists, instead of assuming it does.
2. To prevent future occurrences, EditCategoriesActivity will now
   change the prefs if the category being deleted is the selected one.

title: Add code to cancel notifications
message:
Add code to cancel notifications

A notification for a specific task will now be canceled if the task is
completed/modified/deleted with the notification still visible. This
handles the case of the user entering the app by a different method than
clicking the notification.

title: Finish notifications
message:
Finish notifications

* Notifications are now formatted correctly
* Notifications will vibrate/not vibrate based on user preference
* Deprecated setProcrastinatorAlarm in TaskAlarm. setReminder now
  handles regular and procrastinator alarms.
* Deprecated sendPersistentNotification in NotificationHelper. All
  notifications are now handled through sendBasicNotification.

title: Update Toast notification for repeating tasks
message:
Update Toast notification for repeating tasks

Informs user exactly when the task is due again (if completed after due
date), or when the task will reappear (if completed before the due date)

title: Merge branch 'jon-dev' into develop
message: Merge branch 'jon-dev' into develop

title: Update alarm logic again
message:
Update alarm logic again

If user completes a repeating task before it is due, it will remain
completed until the next "repeat cycle". For example:

Pay rent, due Dec 1. User completes it early on Nov 28. The task will
remain completed until Dec 1, at which time it will uncomplete itself
and show a due date of Jan 1.

title: Update alarm logic
message:
Update alarm logic

Completed tasks that are uncompleted by the user and past due will no
longer immediately send a notification. The service will still
eventually issue a reminder alarm for them, per usual.

RC2 moves forward, database upgrade

title: Update Task class, database, database helper
message:
Update Task class, database, database helper

* This is a comprehensive update that removes final due date, has stop
  repeating date, and stop repeating date from the app
* Task class, the database, and database helper were all modified to
  reflect this change, as well as any activities and services that
  relied on these deprecated fields
* Implemented database upgrade method so tasks from RC1 builds are
  preserved
* Removed FinalDueDateComparator
* Tasks are no longer parcelable (not needed)

message: Add icons to priority spinner in BaseTaskActivity

Update category bar in MainActivity

  assigned to that category

title: Update to category spinners
message:
Update to category spinners

* Fixed a bug where new category dialog would be recreated multiple times
  when the device is rotated
* Fixed a bug that allowed user to enter names with trailing spaces,
  leading to getExistingCategory failing
* If user is creating a category and it already exists, the spinner
  automatically selects that category after exiting the dialog.

title: Change custom datepicker dialog in BaseTaskActivity
message:
Change custom datepicker dialog in BaseTaskActivity

* The custom dialog has been switched to separate standard date and
  time pickers based on user feedback.
* In API 11+, the date picker will show a calendar. Below that,
  spinners are shown.

title: Add due date flags and repeating flags to Tasks
message:
Add due date flags and repeating flags to Tasks

* Several new Task fields:

  hasDueDate           : boolean, true if due date exists for this task

  hasFinalDueDate      : boolean, true if final due date exists for
                         this task

  isRepeating          : boolean, true if task repeats on completion

  hasStopRepeatingDate : boolean, true if task repetition ends on a
                         specified date

  repeatType:	       : int, type of repetition (daily, weekly, etc)

  repeatInterval:      : int, repetition frequency (i.e. every n weeks)

  stopRepeatingDate    : long, date in milliseconds to stop repetition

  stopRepeatingDateCal : Calendar version of stopRepeatingDate

* Task constructors, getters/setters updated for new Task fields

* Database handling updated for new Task fields

* Main Activity checks if new Task has a due date before setting alarm

it comes to using the SQLite database, needed modifications to
MainActivity and DatabaseHandler in order to use the new format.

message:
Scheduling alarms using an IntentService

TaskButlerService (an IntentService) takes care of scheduling Alarms
with the AlarmManager. OnBoot/OnAlarm BroadcastReceivers. and a custom
class to acquire partial WakeLocks.

title: Update data types in SQLite database
message:
Update data types in SQLite database

* Date columns in the database are now of the type DATETIME
* DATETIME is large enough to hold long ints, so the date values no
  longer have to be divided by 60000 in order to be stored in the
  database

title: Fix date bug
message:
Fix date bug

* There was a bug with the date fields in Task objects in that they
  were converting to the wrong date. This was because the date in
  milliseconds is too large for an int.
* All date fields and references have been converted from int to long.
* This was a problem on the database end too, because INTEGERs in
  a SQLite database can only be 8 bits (too small for long int).
* This was fixed by dividing the millisecond value by 60000 to convert
  it to minutes. This allows the data to be small enough to be
  reliably stored.
* A downside is that the precision of the date fields have been reduced
  to minutes, but this isn't really a downside because for the app's
  purposes that is precise enough.

title: Update how tasks are displayed
message:
Update how tasks are displayed

* Changed the adapter of the main activity to show all the fields of
  the Task class. This should be useful for debugging and we will
  change it to something more attractive before release
* Task objects now have Calendar objects as fields, like they did
  before. They will exist and be updated alongside their numeric
  counterparts. This should make everything easier (numeric for
  reading/writing from the database, and Calendar for easy conversion
  to human readable form)

title: Re-implement autosort
message:
Re-implement autosort

* Sorting has been re-implemented
* All comparators have been updated, and new comparators have been
  created
* Fixed a bug where newly created tasks could not be deleted from the
  database until the app had been destroyed and recreated. This was
  happening because the ID of the task was previously unknown until
  after it was entered into the database. Now, the next available ID
  is queried from the database and set in the task before it is added
  to both the database and the list adapter.
* Removed the deprecated classes

Modifying the task list is now exclusively done through the

problems.

title: Remove TaskList.java
message:
Remove TaskList.java

TaskList never became what it was supposed to be. Most of its intended
functionality was implemented in TaskListAdapter. So in interest of
keeping the code clean, it was removed and Tasks are now collected in a
simple ArrayList.
